Package ohos.aafwk.ability

Class DataAbilityHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.aafwk.ability.DataAbilityHelper

  • public class DataAbilityHelper
extends Object
    Helps applications to access data.

    DataAbilityHelper is a helper class for data operations. It uses IDataAbilityObserver to register an observer for monitoring data. You can call creator(ohos.app.Context) to create a DataAbilityHelper instance without specifying the Uri or call creator(ohos.app.Context,ohos.utils.net.Uri,boolean) to create one with a given Uri.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    IDataAbilityObserver, Context, Uri
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITY

    • Method Detail

      • creator

        public static DataAbilityHelper creator​(Context context)
        Creates a DataAbilityHelper instance without specifying the Uri based on the given Context.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the Context object on HarmonyOS.
        Returns:
        Returns the created DataAbilityHelper instance where Uri is not specified.

      • creator

        public static DataAbilityHelper creator​(Context context,
                                        Uri uri)
        Creates a DataAbilityHelper instance with the Uri specified based on the given Context.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the Context object on HarmonyOS.
        uri - Indicates the database table or disk file to operate.
        Returns:
        Returns the created DataAbilityHelper instance with a specified Uri.

      • creator

        public static DataAbilityHelper creator​(Context context,
                                        Uri uri,
                                        boolean tryBind)
        Creates a DataAbilityHelper instance.

        You can use this method to specify the Uri of the data to operate and set the binding relationship between the ability using the Data template (Data ability for short) and the associated client process in a DataAbilityHelper instance.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the Context object on HarmonyOS.
        uri - Indicates the database table to operate.
        tryBind - Specifies whether the exit of the corresponding Data ability process causes the exit of the client process.
        Returns:
        Returns the created DataAbilityHelper instance.

      • release

        public boolean release​()
        Releases the client resource of the Data ability.

        You should call this method to releases client resource after the data operations are complete.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the resource is successfully released; returns false otherwise.

      • registerObserver

        public void registerObserver​(Uri uri,
                             IDataAbilityObserver dataObserver)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Registers an observer to observe data specified by the given Uri.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the data to operate.
        dataObserver - Indicates the IDataAbilityObserver object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.

      • insert

        public int insert​(Uri uri,
                  ValuesBucket value)
           throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Inserts a single data record into the database.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the data to operate.
        value - Indicates the data record to insert. If this parameter is null, a blank row will be inserted.
        Returns:
        Returns the index of the inserted data record.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the dataAbility does not exist.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.

      • batchInsert

        public int batchInsert​(Uri uri,
                       ValuesBucket[] values)
                throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Inserts multiple data records into the database.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the data to operate.
        values - Indicates the data records to insert.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of data records inserted.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the dataAbility does not exist.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.

      • delete

        public int delete​(Uri uri,
                  DataAbilityPredicates predicates)
           throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Deletes one or more data records from the database.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the data to operate.
        predicates - Indicates filter criteria. You should define the processing logic when this parameter is null.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of data records deleted.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the dataAbility does not exist.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.

      • update

        public int update​(Uri uri,
                  ValuesBucket value,
                  DataAbilityPredicates predicates)
           throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Updates data records in the database.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of data to update.
        value - Indicates the data to update. This parameter can be null.
        predicates - Indicates filter criteria. You should define the processing logic when this parameter is null.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of data records updated.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the dataAbility does not exist.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.

      • query

        public ResultSet query​(Uri uri,
                       String[] columns,
                       DataAbilityPredicates predicates)
                throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Queries data in the database.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of data to query.
        columns - Indicates the columns to query. If this parameter is null, all columns are queried.
        predicates - Indicates filter criteria. You should define the processing logic when this parameter is null.
        Returns:
        Returns the query result.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the dataAbility does not exist.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.

      • executeBatch

        public DataAbilityResult[] executeBatch​(Uri uri,
                                        ArrayList<DataAbilityOperation> operations)
                                 throws DataAbilityRemoteException,
                                        OperationExecuteException
        Performs batch operations on the database.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of data to operate.
        operations - Indicates a list of database operations on the database.
        Returns:
        Returns the result of each operation, in array.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        OperationExecuteException - Throws this exception if an operation exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the dataAbility does not exist.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.

      • openFile

        public FileDescriptor openFile​(Uri uri,
                               String mode)
                        throws DataAbilityRemoteException,
                               FileNotFoundException
        Opens a file in a specified remote path.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the file to open.
        mode - Indicates the file open mode, which can be "r" for read-only access, "w" for write-only access (erasing whatever data is currently in the file), "wt" for write access that truncates any existing file, "wa" for write-only access to append to any existing data, "rw" for read and write access on any existing data, or "rwt" for read and write access that truncates any existing file.
        Returns:
        Returns the file descriptor.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Throws this exception if the file is not found.
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the dataAbility does not exist.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri or mode is null.

      • openRawFile

        public RawFileDescriptor openRawFile​(Uri uri,
                                     String mode)
                              throws DataAbilityRemoteException,
                                     FileNotFoundException
        This is like openFile(ohos.utils.net.Uri, java.lang.String), open a file that need to be able to return sub-sections of files，often assets inside of their .hap.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the file to open.
        mode - Indicates the file open mode, which can be "r" for read-only access, "w" for write-only access (erasing whatever data is currently in the file), "wt" for write access that truncates any existing file, "wa" for write-only access to append to any existing data, "rw" for read and write access on any existing data, or "rwt" for read and write access that truncates any existing file.
        Returns:
        Returns the RawFileDescriptor object containing file descriptor.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Throws this exception if the file is not found.
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the dataAbility does not exist.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri or mode is null.

      • getFileTypes

        public String[] getFileTypes​(Uri uri,
                             String mimeTypeFilter)
                      throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Obtains the MIME types of files supported.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the files to obtain.
        mimeTypeFilter - Indicates the MIME types of the files to obtain. This parameter cannot be null.

        1. "*/*": Obtains all types supported by Data abilities.

        2. "image/*": Obtains files whose main type is image of any subtype.

        3. "*/jpg": Obtains files whose subtype is JPG of any main type.

        Returns:
        Returns the matched MIME types. If there is no match, null is returned.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri or mimeTypeFilter is null.

      • call

        public PacMap call​(Uri uri,
                   String method,
                   String arg,
                   PacMap extras)
            throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Calls the method defined by the Data ability.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the Data ability to process.
        method - Indicates the method name.
        arg - Indicates the parameter of the String type.
        extras - Indicates the parameter of the PacMap type. If a custom Sequenceable object is put in the PacMap object and will be transferred across processes, you must call BasePacMap.setClassLoader(ClassLoader) to set a class loader for the custom object.
        Returns:
        Returns the value returned by the called method.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri or method is null.

      • getType

        public String getType​(Uri uri)
               throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Obtains the MIME type of the date specified by the given URI.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the data to operate.
        Returns:
        Returns the MIME type that matches the data specified by uri.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.

      • normalizeUri

        public Uri normalizeUri​(Uri uri)
                 throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Converts the given uri that refers to the Data ability into a normalized Uri. A normalized URI can be used across devices, persisted, backed up, and restored.

        To transfer a normalized URI from another environment to the current environment, you should call this method again to re-normalize the URI for the current environment or call denormalizeUri(ohos.utils.net.Uri) to convert it to a denormalized URI that can be used only in the current environment.

        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the Uri object to normalize.
        Returns:
        Returns the normalized Uri object if the Data ability supports URI normalization; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if the remote process exits.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        denormalizeUri(ohos.utils.net.Uri)

      • denormalizeUri

        public Uri denormalizeUri​(Uri uri)
                   throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Converts the given normalized uri generated by normalizeUri(ohos.utils.net.Uri) into a denormalized one.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the Uri object to denormalize.
        Returns:
        Returns the denormalized Uri object if the denormalization is successful; returns the original Uri passed to this method if there is nothing to do; returns null if the data identified by the normalized Uri cannot be found in the current environment.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if the remote process exits.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        normalizeUri(ohos.utils.net.Uri)

      • reload

        public boolean reload​(Uri uri,
                      PacMap extras)
               throws DataAbilityRemoteException
        Reloads data in the database.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the position where the data is to reload. This parameter is mandatory.
        extras - Indicates the PacMap object containing the additional parameters to be passed in this call. This parameter can be null. If a custom Sequenceable object is put in the PacMap object and will be transferred across processes, you must call BasePacMap.setClassLoader(ClassLoader) to set a class loader for the custom object.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is successfully reloaded; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if the remote process is abnormal.
        Since:
        4

      • obtainInputStream

        public InputStream obtainInputStream​(Uri uri)
                              throws DataAbilityRemoteException,
                                     FileNotFoundException
        Obtains the input stream of a file. You must have correctly implemented the Ability.openFile(Uri, String) method before using this method.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the file to open.
        Returns:
        Returns the input stream of the file.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Throws this exception if the file is not found.
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the specified URI does not exist.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.
        Since:
        5

      • obtainOutputStream

        public OutputStream obtainOutputStream​(Uri uri)
                                throws DataAbilityRemoteException,
                                       FileNotFoundException
        Obtains the output stream of a file. You must have correctly implemented the Ability.openFile(Uri, String) method before using this method.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the file to open.
        Returns:
        Returns the output stream of the file.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Throws this exception if the file is not found.
        DataAbilityRemoteException - Throws this exception if a remote process exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the specified URI does not exist.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if uri is null.
        Since:
        5
